title: Firefox Slow on Pixel A Phones – Any Fixes?
content:
Hello,

I'm experiencing performance issues when loading webpages on Firefox on my Pixel A phone. I usually keep only one tab open and run uBlock Origin. I mainly visit sites like Best Buy and Amazon, but honestly, all webpages take forever to load.

Could this be due to the 8GB of RAM on the Pixel A series? On my Samsung S24 Ultra, I rarely run into these issues.

I love Firefox and will continue to support it, but this is really heartbreaking. Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!
creator: ValiexCruz

title: Can’t sign into Firefox Account — used Google Sign-In, now it asks for a password I don’t have
content: I’m having trouble accessing my Firefox Account. I originally created the account by using “Sign in with Google.” Recently, Firefox started prompting me for a password to log in for sync but I don't remember what it was. When I try to reset the password it doesn’t work because my account is tied to Google sign-in. I’m now stuck and can’t access my account through the browser or sync my data I can simply log into forum or change settings that's it. How can I set a password if I used Google Sign-In to create the account?
creator: cadewoods1704

title: Cannot remove persistent site data from Manage Data under Privacy & Security
content:
I have a MacBook Pro running Sequoia 15.3.2. When I remove all data from Firefox (137.0 (aarch64)) in Manage Data under Privacy & Security there is one site datum that always returns. It is 64k of data, 0 cookies, that persists after every clean up. This has been going on for quite a while.

I've searched Finder for any reference to the company name and cannot find any reference.

It isn't a lot of data, but I'd prefer to not have something lingering around.

Does anyone have a suggestion for how to delete this once and for all?
creator: ascot_60_vestals

title: Heading font size
content: Yesteday, 4/9/25, I did a Microsoft update on my system. As soon as I opened my browser afterward, all the fonts on the toolbars, tabs, menus, search bar,etc. were changed from the font point they were at, to some miniscule, barely seeable size. This is happening to everything above the work screen in Firefox, and my File Explorer. Everything below the search bar line is as it should be. How do I resize all the toolbars etc. to their previous size? Thank you for any relevant assistance.
